intro: Nototriche peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
